verses.roman:
ya idaṁ kīrtayed viṣṇoḥ
karma caidya-vadhādikam
rāja-mokṣaṁ vitānaṁ ca
sarva-pāpaiḥ pramucyate

synonyms: yaḥ—who; idam—these; kīrtayet—chants; viṣṇoḥ—of Lord Viṣṇu; karma—activities; caidya-vadha—the killing of Śiśupāla; ādikam—and so on; rāja—of the kings (who were imprisoned by Jarāsandha); mokṣam—the deliverance; vitānam—the sacrifice; ca—and; sarva—from all; pāpaiḥ—sinful reactions; pramucyate—he is freed.
translation: One who recites these activities of Lord Viṣṇu, including the killing of Śiśupāla, the deliverance of the kings and the performance of the Rājasūya sacrifice, is freed from all sins.
